text: And you won’t get minified css if you have nested block comment: `/* blalba /*blah */ blah */`.
good to know
For completeness, if you have `0%` for `hsla` or `rgb` in you css, you won’t get minified either.
The pattern is: `"(hsla\\(0%,)|(rgb\\(0%,)|(@supports)|(0s)"`
might be worth having a temporary article in the dev docs noting each of these, until you guys are able to switch minifiers.
<@U6W3H6YN8>
granted 0s and rgba 0% or hsla 0% we shouldn’t be doing on our end in the first place, but I could see someone having them by accident programmatically.
You can get around those issues by using 0.01. I will think about where this could live in docs if needed.

nope.  damn

i had a placeholder for a text field to give the module a unique id.  had unique_id as the placeholder.  in the content editor, it filled it with some numbers.  removed placeholder and set to default text and it resolved
in case anyone was curious :slightly_smiling_face:

BTW <@UD53A9UUR> idk what you’re using the module id for but you can actually grab the module’s unique id in the page if you’re trying to use that to prevent conflicts with other instances of the same module in the page
